author: gstein
msg: Our additional copyfrom records create spurious "Adds" when reading the
entries back out. Thus, we need to collapse the copies back down when we
detect them. The original mixed-rev information is returned in
entry->revision.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/entries.c:
(read_entries): if the node has copyfrom information, then look to see
if it was an *introduced* set of copyfrom information for mixed-rev
purposes. if so, then pretend it wasn't there, and stick to a normal
"copied child" response for the entry.

author: gstein
msg: Re-enable the copyfrom construction. The errors that I saw before was
simply because I forgot to clear a return error.
Also, added a number of tests to ensure that we got a *valid* result from
the scan_working call. During an add or copy, we might be called when the
metadata is in a weird, inconsistent state. When that happens, we'll just
ignore any result and expect to get things fixed up later.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/entries.c:
(write_entry): re-enable the code that constructs additional copyfrom
records for mixed-rev working copy copies.

author: blair
msg: Follow up to r36767, remove unnecessary parens.
* contrib/client-side/svnmerge/svnmerge.py
(set_props):
Parentheses are not needed.

author: hwright
msg: Allow us to conditionalize test XFAILures based upon whether or not we are
using wc-ng.  We've fixed a couple of legitimate bugs with the current wc-ng
work, and this allows us to codify that in the tests.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/info_tests.py
(test_list): Pass test 2 when running wc-ng.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/svntest/main.py
(is_not_ng): New.

author: pburba
msg: Follow-up to r36086, fix some dopey Python.
Suggested by: gstein
* contrib/client-side/svnmerge/svnmerge.py
(set_props): This ain't C.  Embrace it.
